title: Regarding additional course
content:

Would it be difficult to balance my curriculum? And mainly is IT OF ANY USE ???

comments.body: What is the point of holding multiple bachelor's degrees in CS? It would have made more sense if you weren't in CS already. I am curious to know why you think multiple UG degrees in CS will help you.
Actually I thought that as it's of BITS ,it would give me more opportunities in future during placements

1. Online degrees do not carry the same weight as equivalent offline ones (at least, not yet) since the entry bar is much lower. It is not the same as actually pursuing the degree offline from BITS. You will still be considered a graduate of PES with an online degree from BITS. Not a graduate of BITS. 
2. You will sit for placements from PES, which means you will be recognised as a PESt. When it comes to off-campus, do you plan to hide your PES degree? If yes then you have only an online UG degree which companies do not prefer and is not treated seriously. If not, then don't think that having 2 CS degrees is going to raise eyebrows about your decision?

Can this type of online degree help me in building my profile for further studies?
It's not an offer, anybody who wishes to pursue that online degree can pay the fee and do it on coursera
Yeah but I got a mail from them which says accept your offer
Brother even PES sends us emails to enroll for MTech, does not mean they are inviting you personally xD
They can help you cover missing coursework requirements but will not replace your PES degree.
No no.... I mean can these types of various courses help me to strengthen my resume for further studies.

Doing courses does not strengthen your resume. Only skills matter, and evidence of those skills are projects or experiences. These courses can at best help you cover missing courses that might be needed to clear admission requirements. At worst, they aren't going to add anything.

If your goal is a Masters, then it is your CGPA, SOP and other essays, LORs and overall profile comprising your skills, experiences, projects etc that will matter. Completing a course from BITS/IIT etc will not add anything here, except to help you meet requirements as I mentioned. If you are in ECE or other non-CS branches and do not take up a CS Minors at PES, then it is reasonable to take it up. However, if you are already from CS, and are applying to CS programs, then you already have those requirements met and the course will add zero value.
